dublin_core.dcvalue: Recognition of cardiac arrest CA during an emergency call leans on questions concerning CA symptoms and is correct in 50 83 of cases If the heart rhythm could be recorded and analysed over a mobile phone or transmitted during the emergency call to the dispatch centre and analysed there using software identical to one in an automated external defibrillator AED CA recognition could be more prompt We investigated whether an AED can correctly analyse normal heart rhythms recorded within an area the size of a mobile phone
European journal of emergency medicine : official journal of the European Society for Emergency Medicine
The feasibility of recognizing the heart rhythm with an automated external defibrillator from an area the size of a mobile phone.
